post_text: November 3, 2015 at 2:18 PM#1Hello,I created a macroCopy group 6 + 2 At 161/0But the groups  separate stored  instead of together in one group.In the store options Allow Embedded on.Thanks in advance

posts.author: Duplicate Ryan Kanarek
posts.post_text: November 3, 2015 at 3:16 PM#2Allow embedded is just for presets.[color=#66FF00]ClearSelection[/color][color=#66FF00]Group[/color] 6 [color=#66FF00]+[/color] 2[color=#66FF00]Store Group[/color] 161 /o[color=#66FF00]ClearSelection[/color]

posts.author: costalight
posts.post_text: November 3, 2015 at 7:45 PM#3it does not work.Error #72:Command not executed.?Thanks

posts.author: Duplicate Ryan Kanarek
posts.post_text: November 4, 2015 at 4:27 AM#6Not sure what to tell you. ClearSelection is a valid command. Could try replacing with [color=#66FF00]Clear[/color] instead.

posts.author: Duplicate dherderich
posts.post_text: November 4, 2015 at 10:24 AM#7ClearSelection will only work, if you have a Slection active at the moment.Try the macro with Clear, or ClearAll. But keep in mind, that ClearAll will clear the whole programmer.

posts.author: Duplicate Ryan Kanarek
posts.post_text: November 4, 2015 at 2:42 PM#8Wellthatdoesn't make sense. Why should ClearAll work if you have nothing in your programmer, but not ClearSelection or ClearActive? (EDIT: "be allowed," not "work")In any case, if you wanted it a bit safer, you could go into BlindEdit:BlindEdit OnClearGroup 6 + 2Store Group 161 /oClearBlindEdit Off

title: Macro Store Allow Embedded on
